project_overview.name: Customer Onboarding and Success Portal (COSP)
project_overview.description: A customer-facing portal to streamline onboarding, provide self-service resources, and improve customer success metrics.

feature_breakdown.description: Allow customers to log in to the COSP using their main SaaS product credentials.
technical_requirements: SSO provider integration (e.g., Azure AD, Google, etc.)
acceptance_criteria: Customers can log in with a single click using their existing credentials
No additional login required for the COSP

feature_breakdown.description: Display a customized onboarding checklist based on the customer's subscription tier.
technical_requirements: Dynamic content generation based on customer data
Workflow engine to manage onboarding steps
acceptance_criteria: Customers see a personalized onboarding checklist on their first login
Checklist updates as the customer completes tasks

feature_breakdown.description: Integrate the COSP with the existing knowledge base API to enable seamless content searching and viewing.
acceptance_criteria: Customers can search and view all product documentation within the COSP
Seamless transition between the COSP and knowledge base content

feature_breakdown.description: Display a dashboard showing the customer's adoption metrics (e.g., daily active users, feature usage count).
acceptance_criteria: Customers can see their key usage metrics at a glance
Dashboard updates automatically as new data becomes available

feature_breakdown.description: Provide a 'Contact CSM' button that pre-populates an email or a Zendesk ticket with customer details.
acceptance_criteria: Customers can easily contact their CSM with a single click
Ticket or email is pre-populated with relevant customer information

technical_architecture.data_flow: Customer data and usage metrics flow from the SaaS product and CRM into the COSP's data stores. The COSP then aggregates and visualizes this data for the customer.
security_considerations: Secure API communication using OAuth 2.0 and TLS 1.2+
Role-based access control for COSP features

implementation_phases.description: Deliver the core functionality of the COSP, including self-service onboarding, knowledge base integration, and customer usage dashboards.
deliverables: API Integrations (SaaS Product, Knowledge Base, CRM)

implementation_phases.description: Implement the 'Contact CSM' feature to improve customer support efficiency.
Optimize the COSP for performance and scalability to handle increased user traffic.

risk_analysis.description: Delays in third-party API integration (SaaS Product, Knowledge Base, CRM, Zendesk)
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Engage with integration partners early, establish clear communication and escalation channels, and have a contingency plan for manual data entry.

risk_analysis.description: Complexity in developing the personalized onboarding checklists and workflow engine
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Allocate sufficient time and resources for the feature, conduct thorough design and planning, and consider a phased rollout approach.

risk_analysis.description: Challenges in achieving the desired performance and scalability targets
risk_analysis.mitigation_strategy: Implement comprehensive performance testing early, identify and address bottlenecks, and plan for future scalability needs.

tools_and_technologies: Jira, Confluence, and GitLab for project management and collaboration
infrastructure_needs: AWS EC2 instances for application hosting
AWS API Gateway and Lambda for serverless integration

success_metrics.measurement_method: Tracked through the CRM and customer data
Tracked through the onboarding workflow and customer data

success_metrics.target_value: 25% reduction in time spent on manual onboarding tasks
success_metrics.measurement_method: Tracked through CSM activity logs and customer data

success_metrics.target_value: Increase to 40% of support questions resolved via the portal
success_metrics.measurement_method: Tracked through the portal usage data and support ticket logs
